title: Latest News from Science Magazine
description: Keyword search result for Alerts: News Weekly Headlines -- New results matching your keyword search query (updated daily).

items.title: NASA’s Mars Sample Return mission is dead
items.description: Congress backs Trump administration’s efforts to kill project that would ferry martian rocks to Earth

items.title: Fresh conflicts erupt around giant database for flu and COVID-19 sequences
items.description: Critics say “autocratic” behavior by GISAID could hamper response to a future pandemic

items.title: Appeals court agrees that NIH cannot reduce overhead payments to academic institutions
items.description: Judges uphold injunction by lower court against a 15% flat rate for indirect costs

items.title: Exclusive: Have scientists found Leonardo da Vinci’s DNA?
items.description: Inside the decadeslong quest to reveal the genes of a genius—and revolutionize art authentication

items.title: Against all odds, a curious sea creature survived the dino-killing asteroid
items.description: Coil-shelled mollusks called ammonites staved off extinction for thousands of years

items.title: Jellyfish sleep a lot like us—and for the same reasons
items.description: Study adds to evidence that sleep likely evolved among ancient animals as a means of repairing neurons

items.title: Congress set to reject Trump’s major budget cuts to NSF, NASA, and energy science
items.description: Appropriators agree instead to keep this year’s spending nearly level

items.title: Deep-sea earthquakes fuel huge plankton blooms in Antarctica
items.description: Hydrothermal vents spurred by seismic activity feed vital nutrients to Antarctic microbes

items.title: As deep-sea mining race ramps up, mission will assess whether ecosystems recover afterward
items.description: A new series of research cruises will study rare abyssal species in areas slated for mining

items.title: Blood-cleansing method faces its first test as cancer vaccine
items.description: New clinical trial aims to use whole, light-inactivated tumor cells for immunotherapy
